column2: Wait. Before we go in, I just want you to know I love you. I had a\ngreat time on our honeymoon, and I can\xc2\x92t wait to go in there and spend the rest of\nour life together.'
You\xc2\x92re really sticking with the shell necklace huh? (Points to\nnecklace of shells he\xc2\x92s wearing.)'
Hi!'
Hey! You\xc2\x92re back! (Hugs and kisses all around.)'
Hi sweetie!'
Come on in! '
So how was the honeymoon?'
Oh, so much fun. But the best part is, we met this incredible couple on\nthe way back.'
That was the best part? (To Chandler) Good honeymooning tiger.'
No, they were really cool. They were on their honeymoon too!'
They\xc2\x92re terrific, and they live right here in the city.'
Yeah, can we go call them? Is it too soon to call? I wanna call.'
I\xc2\x92m sorry, we\xc2\x92re just kinda excited because we finally have\na couple to hang out with.'
I know.'
A couple? Like two people? Like (points to himself) one (points to\nPhoebe), two people?'
This is different! Greg and Jenny are in a relationship.'
Oh, Greg and Jenny yuck! (Angrily) Hi Greg, I\xc2\x92m Chandler this is\nMonica. Hi Monica, this is Jenny. Hi Jenny. Hi Greg.'
Listen, they are really great. If you just got a chance\xc2\x85'
Y\xc2\x92know what? Why don\xc2\x92t you just give us our souvenirs and get\nthe hell out of here?'
We really\xc2\x85didn\xc2\x92t get a chance to\xc2\x85'
You have got to be kidding me!'
We didn\xc2\x92t get anything for anyone.'
Hm-mm! Yeah nice necklace!'
That you can have.'
Hi!'
Hey!'
Hello!'
Welcome home.'
So, how was the honeymoon?'
It was great! It was great! How about you?! I mean you\xc2\x92re having a\nbaby!'
Oh! Look! I have a sonogram picture! '
Oh great! (Shows them the picture.)'
Ross! It\xc2\x92s got your wavy black lines!'
All right, so now that Ross knows can you tell us y\xc2\x92know how it\nhappened? I mean, when did it happen? How many times did it happen?'
Monica! That\xc2\x92s not right! Start with where.'
Well it happened about six weeks ago, and uh I had just got home from\nwork and Ross was already there \xc2\x91cause I guess he had been hanging out with Joey.'
You\xc2\x92re welcome buddy.'
(glaring at him) Yeah, thanks. (Joey nods no problem.)'

And so I had a lot of work to do so Ross, nice guy that he is, offered\nto help me out. And then we had a little wine, we got to talking, and the next thing you\nknow out of nowhere Ross comes on to me.'
(laughs) Umm that\xc2\x92s\xc2\x85that\xc2\x92s a little misleading.'
What is?'
The lie you just told.'
That-that you came on to me?'
There\xc2\x92s the one!'
But you did! I mean, let\xc2\x92s be honest.'

Yes let\xc2\x92s. Y\xc2\x92know what? Uh, it\xc2\x92s-it\xc2\x92s not important.\nWhat is important is that, is that we\xc2\x92re having a baby. And it\xc2\x92s\nnot\xc2\x97Doesn\xc2\x92t matter who came on to who.'
Whom. (Everyone looks at him shocked.) That\xc2\x92s right.'
You know you kissed me first.'
What? What?! You were begging me to kiss you! You-you-you were sending me\nsignals all over the place!'
I was sending you signals?'
Yeah!'
Oh please. Okay, anyone in this room think that I would send Ross\nbegging symbols, please show of hands. (Ross raises his hand and no one else.)'
Y\xc2\x92know what?! It doesn\xc2\x92t matter! It doesn\xc2\x92t matter what you\nbelieve! What matters is what happened!'
Okay. So these signals Ross, explain this to me, \xc2\x91cause maybe I\nneed to be more careful. I mean, am I sending you these signals right now?'
Y\xc2\x92know what? Y\xc2\x92know what? Rachel, just-just drop it.'
No please, show me how I begged you!'
I can show you, I have it on videotape! (Stunned silence) It\xc2\x92s an\nexpression.'
I can\xc2\x92t believe he taped the two of them having sex!'
Yeah! You gotta tell a girl before you tape her. Such a rookie mistake.'
Y\xc2\x92know who has a great video camera?'
(nasally) Greg and Jenny?'
Do you still wanna call \xc2\x91em? I wanna call \xc2\x91em.'
Let\xc2\x92s call \xc2\x91em.'
Yeah! Ask them if they brought their friends any souvenirs!'
(on phone) Hello? (Listens) Eighth street deli?'
Hey, hang up! You get food poisoning just talkin\xc2\x92 to that place.'
(on phone) Uh sorry, wrong number. (Hangs up)'
Here you go. (Shows her the number again.)'
(on phone) Hello? (Listens) (To All) It\xc2\x92s the deli again!'
All right! I\xc2\x92ll have a sandwich!'
(hangs up) I don\xc2\x92t think this number\xc2\x92s right!'
What?'
You got fake numbered.'
What?! People don\xc2\x92t do that!'
Oh I think we do.'
They gave us a fake number? Why? Why would they do that?'
I don\xc2\x92t know! You were a delight to talk to. You asked all those\ninsightful, great questions.'
And you\xc2\x92ve never been funnier. Joke, joke, joke, you were a hoot!'
Y\xc2\x92know what? Don\xc2\x92t worry about it, you still got me and Phoebe.'
Excuse me, I don\xc2\x92t want Greg and Jenny\xc2\x92s rejects.'
(entering) Rachel won\xc2\x92t talk to me! She won\xc2\x92t even open the\ndoor!'
Hmm, I wonder why. Pervert!'
Okay, listen I am not a pervert!'
That\xc2\x92s like the pervert motto! Yeah! Yeah! They have you raise your\nright hand, put your left hand down your pants, and repeat that!'

Filming Rachel is not something I planned. Okay look, here\xc2\x92s what\nhappened, and Joey you-you can back me up on this. All right, about-about a month and a\nhalf ago I came to you with a problem? Umm, a personal thing. '
Personal thing? What personal thing? I don\xc2\x92t know.'
About\xc2\x85about sex? (Joey looks at him confused) That I hadn\xc2\x92t had\nsex in months?'
(laughs) Yeah I knew what you were talkin\xc2\x92 about.'
Hey!'
Hey.'
Do you have a minute? I\xc2\x92d like to talk to you about something\nI\xc2\x92m, I\xc2\x92m really uncomfortable talking about.'
Sure. What? About uh, you showering with your mom?'
I actually had a topic in mind! I\xc2\x92m, I\xc2\x92m kinda going through a\ndry spell, sex wise.'
Whoa, for like months?'
Five to be lying, six.'
Six months? Whoa that\xc2\x92s rough.'
Well, I mean it\xc2\x92s not all bad. I\xc2\x92m learning to appreciate the\nuh, smaller things in life. Like the sound of a bird and the color of the sky.'
The sky\xc2\x92s blue Ross and I had sex yesterday!'
Please, help me! I have a date tonight. It has to go well\nokay\xc2\x97I\xc2\x92m scared for my health!'
Okay. Okay. Umm\xc2\x85Ooh! Oh-oh, I got something. It\xc2\x92s this story I\ncame up with, very romantic. I swear any woman that hears it; they\xc2\x92re like putty.'
Really? Well then tell it to me.'
Okay. Now you\xc2\x92re gonna want to have sex with me when you hear it, but\nyou have to remember it is just the story.'
(sarcastic) I\xc2\x92ll try to control myself.'
Okay. (Clears throat) Years ago, when I was backpacking across Western\nEurope\xc2\x85'
(laughs) You were backpacking across Western Europe?'
Have a nice six more months Ross! (Starts to leave.)'
(stopping him) Okay! Okay! Okay. I\xc2\x92m sorry. Please, please, you were\nin Western Europe and?'

I was just outside Barcelona hiking in the foothills of Mount Tibidabo. I
was at the end of this path and I came to a clearing and there was a lake, very secluded.
And there were tall trees all around. (Whispering) It was dead silent. Gorgeous. (Softly)
And across the lake I saw\xc2\x85a beautiful woman\xc2\x85bathing herself\xc2\x85but she was
crying\xc2\x85'
(intently listening) Why?'
Umm, this is great wine.'
It\xc2\x92s from France\xc2\x85In Europe\xc2\x85Western Europe. Y\xc2\x92know umm,\na few years ago I actually was backpacking across Western Europe.'
Really?'
Uh-hmm\xc2\x97Wait! It gets better. Um, yeah I was in Barcelona.'
I studied for a year in Barcelona. (Ross is stunned and worried.)'
Anyway, umm so I was um, I was hiking\xc2\x85'
I love hiking!'
(whines) Oh that\xc2\x92s great! I was hiking along the foothills of Mount\nTibidaybo\xc2\x85'
I think its Tibidabo.'
Okay! Do you wanna tell the story?!'
Whoa! What are you doing here? How did your date go?'
Great! I\xc2\x92m across the street having sex with her right now. Your\nstory sucks!'
Hey! Look, if it didn\xc2\x92t work it\xc2\x92s because you didn\xc2\x92t tell\nit right! Show me how you did it.'
No! No, I don\xc2\x92t\xc2\x85don\xc2\x92t want to.'
How long since you\xc2\x92ve seen a girl naked?'
I was backpacking across Western Europe.'
I\xc2\x92m not feeling it.'
I was just outside Barcelona, hiking\xc2\x85'
No! No! No Ross! I\xc2\x92m not hot! Are you hot?'
It\xc2\x92s been six months! I\xc2\x92m always hot!'

Well you\xc2\x92re not selling the story! It\xc2\x92s like; it\xc2\x92s like you
don\xc2\x92t believe it! Look, I gotta go. I got a date, but try this. Do what I do when
I\xc2\x92m preparing for an audition. Okay? I\xc2\x92ll set you up with my video camera and
you can record yourself and-and see what you\xc2\x92re doing wrong.'
I\xc2\x92ll try that.'
All right now\xc2\x85 All right, you\xc2\x92re all set up. You\xc2\x92re good to\ngo. Just hit record. All right?'
Thanks.'
Good luck.'
Thanks. And-and hey Joe?'
Yeah?'
Listen, if you ever have any problem with the ladies you know I\xc2\x92ll\nhelp you out.'
(trying not to laugh) That means a lot to me man. (Exits.)'
Hello! Can I get you anything? Huh? Lens cleaner? Your battery okay?\n(Rachel bursts in carrying two boxes and Ross jumps up.) Rachel!'
Oh Ross!'
Hi!'
Thank God you\xc2\x92re here! You have to help me! Were you just talking\nto yourself?'
That\xc2\x92s less embarrassing, yes. Yes I was.'
(voiceover) So when she came in, I got distracted and totally forgot about\nthe camera. [Cut back to the present day.] It kept rolling and recorded everything.'
Yeah, we\xc2\x92re gonna need to see that tape. (They rest of them\nagree.)'
Yeah, definitely.'
What a great idea! That will get Rachel to forgive me!'
Y\xc2\x92know what? This is not fair to her. Let\xc2\x92s just forget the\ntape!'
Thank you. (Joey mouths to Ross, "You\xc2\x92ll show me right?")\nNo!'
You\xc2\x92re right. (Mouths, "I know you\xc2\x92ll show me, right?)'
Joey! No!'
Loud and clear! (Mouths, "You\xc2\x92ll show me," and nods.)'
I still don't get why Greg and Jenny would give us a fake number."
Y\xc2\x92know, if they knew what they were doing they probably didn\xc2\x92t\ngive you real names either.'
Okay, maybe people give out fake numbers, but they don\xc2\x92t give out\nfake names.'
Oh yeah? (To Phoebe) Hi, Ken Adams, nice to meet you.'
Regina Philange. (Ken and Regina shake hands.)'
I still don\xc2\x92t get it, we didn\xc2\x92t do anything wrong.'
I know! Although, you did tell an awful lot of jokes.'
I thought you said those jokes were funny. Joke! Joke! Joke!'
(rolling her head from side to side) Joke. Joke. Blah! Blah! (Joey and\nPhoebe laugh.)'
Well maybe it was all of your questions.'
What about my questions?'
The sheer volume, it was like flying with the Riddler!'
Oh, I\xc2\x92m sorry. Was that another joke?'
(angrily) Was that another question?'
(entering) Hey! Is Ross still here?'
Uh no Rach, he\xc2\x92s gone. But listen, he told us what happened and it\ndoes, it sounds like an honest mistake.'

Oh really? Well how would you like it if I had sex with you and I taped\nit? (Joey smiles luridly) Oh forget it! (Ross enters.) Oh there he is now, the father of\nmy child, the porn king of the west village.'

Look, it was accident! Okay? I-I feel bad that it happened, but I swear, I\ndidn\xc2\x92t even watch it! Anyway, here. (He takes the tape out of his coat pocket.) I\nthought you might be more comfortable destroying it yourself. (Tosses her the tape.)'

Thank you. (She sets it on the floor and is about to stomp on it with\nher shoe when the rest of the gang jumps up and yells simultaneously.) What? (They all\nyell again.) You don\xc2\x92t want to see this do you?'
Hell yeah!!!'
I am not gonna show you this!'
No! Not the sex part, just the stuff leading up to it.'
Forget it, she\xc2\x92s destroying it.'
Okay fine! Fine! We\xc2\x92ll just have to think of some other way to put\nthe whole \xc2\x91Who came onto who,\xc2\x92 thing to rest! Come on now, think!!'
Look, forget it Phoebe. Okay? It\xc2\x92s Rachel\xc2\x92s tape and she can do\nwhatever she wants with it. And she wants to destroy it. So, end of story.'
I wanna see it.'
What?!'
Clearly you don\xc2\x92t want people to see this tape. Now I don\xc2\x92t\nwant people to see this tape either, but you so badly don\xc2\x92t people to see it makes me\nwant to see it. You see?'
(confused) Are we watchin\xc2\x92 the tape or not?!'
I don\xc2\x92t want people to see it for your sake.'
Ahh, I don\xc2\x92t believe you. I think you don\xc2\x92t want them to see\nyou begging me. (Goes to put the tape in the VCR)'
Rachel, please\xc2\x85'
Ah, a little preview!'
Fine. Fine, but I want the record to show that I tried to take the high\nroad, because in about five minutes I\xc2\x92m gonna be saying\xc2\x85(He laughs and points at\nRachel sarcastically.)'
Okay, here we go. (Pushes play.)'
(on tape) Hello! Can I get you anything?'
(To Phoebe) I\xc2\x92m so happy!'
(on tape) Oh, thank God you\xc2\x92re here! You have to help me! Were you\njust talking to yourself?'
There I am.'
You\xc2\x92re gonna get pregnant.'
(on tape) I screwed up so bad, I told Monica that I would stuff and send\nall these wedding invitations like weeks ago and I-I\xc2\x85'
(on tape) You didn\xc2\x92t do it?'
(on tape) I-I know\xc2\x97I had put them in\xc2\x85in-in my desk at work and\nI completely forgot about them until today.'
(taking Rachel\xc2\x92s hand) Sweetie okay. It\xc2\x92s okay. Everybody made\nit to the wedding. I\xc2\x92m fine.'
Kinda hurtin\xc2\x92 my hand though.'
I know.'

(on tape) (Ross hands her a glass of wine) I cannot believe that I did
this. Especially after Monica just went on and on and on about it! (Mimicking Monica)
"Okay Rachel! Here are the invitations Rachel! Now be very careful Rachel! Please,
drinking no liquids around the invitations Rachel!" (She tilts her wine glass above
and moves it back and forth across the invitations) Whoa oh! Oh-oh-oh!
Oh\xc2\x85oh-oh-oh\xc2\x85'
Did you do it on our invitations?!'
(pause) Not on the ones we sent out.'
So, just the ones gave back to us and we had framed! (Slams the framed\ninvitation down onto the table.)'
(on tape) Can you believe this is already happening? I mean it seems\nlike yesterday they just got engaged.'
(on tape) I know. Hey remember\xc2\x85remember the night they got engaged?\nHow uh, you and I almost\xc2\x85'
(on tape) Oh, I remember how we almost. Do you think we would\xc2\x92ve\ngone through with it? Y\xc2\x92know, if we hadn\xc2\x92t gotten caught. Do you think we\nwould\xc2\x92ve done it?'
(on tape) I mean I\xc2\x85I know I wanted to. I just, I just wasn\xc2\x92t\nsure if you wanted to.'
(on tape) Oh I wanted to.'
(on tape) So we\xc2\x85we both wanted to.'
(on tape) Interesting.'
(on tape) Yeah. (Pause) Anyway umm, it probably worked out for the best.'
(on tape) Oh yeah, sure.'
Okay, in about ten seconds you\xc2\x92re gonna see him kiss me.'
And in about five seconds you\xc2\x92re gonna see why.'
(on tape) Ross did I ever tell you about the time that I went\nbackpacking through Western Europe?'
Okay, get ready to see some beggin\xc2\x92!'
Oh, you came on to Ross!'
What?!'
Now I\xc2\x92m so happy.'
What are you talking about?!'
You used the Europe story!'
That\xc2\x92s the magic story you use when you wanna have sex!'
How do you know about that story?!'
How do you know about that story?!'
I heard it from my friend Irene who heard it from some guy!'
(raises his hand) Some guy!! (Points to himself.)'
No. No, she told me his name was Ken Adams.'
(raises his hand and points to himself again) Ken Adams!!'
Hi.'
So uh, apparently people are familiar with the Europe story?'

Yeah. Listen about that, the whole uh, who came on to who thing really\ndoesn\xc2\x92t matter. I mean, I think it would\xc2\x92ve happened either way. I mean if you\nhadn\xc2\x92t initiated it I-I-I know I would\xc2\x92ve.'
It was an amazing night.'
It was. It was an amazing night.'
You think it looked amazing?'
I uh\xc2\x85 I don\xc2\x92t know. I mean I\xc2\x85I honestly didn\xc2\x92t watch\nit.'
Yeah, me neither. Yet\xc2\x85'
Uhhhhhh\xc2\x85that-that may be weird.'
Yeah, it would be really weird.'
Good luck.'
Good luck to you.'
Mind if I mute?'
Oh please. (He does so.)'
Oh, oh there go the clothes.'
You are undressing very quickly.'
Six months Rachel, six months.'
Ah. (Pause) Oh.'
Hey. We-we look\xc2\x85we look pretty good.'
That\xc2\x92s what I was gonna say.'
Oh nice tan!'
Thank you! I had just gone to the beach that weekend.'
Ah\xc2\x85.'
Have you been working out?'
I have been working out.'
Really? Wow, this is so much better than I\xc2\x85'
Ohh! Ew!'
Oh that\xc2\x92s not pretty.'
Oh! Oh!'
No!'
Oh God!'
Oh no!'
Oh, make it stop!'
Oh no!!'
Make it stop!!'
No!!'
Have to make it stop!!'

(on phone) Hello Greg? (Listens) Hi, this is Monica from the plane?\nListen, the number that you gave me 853-5\xc2\x85 (Listens) (To Chandler) That is their old\nnumber! Jenny\xc2\x92s been giving it out since they moved!'
Jenny! That is so Jenny!'

(on phone) Hey listen umm, how would you like to get together? Say next
Saturday? (Listens) Okay, how about Sunday? (Listens) Okay umm, the week after that?
(Listens) The week after that? (Listens) Y\xc2\x92know what Greg? Y\xc2\x92know what? We are
good, interesting, funny people with good questions and if you and your precious
Jenny can\xc2\x92t see that then\xc2\x85 (Listens) January 15th? (Chandler dances.)
We\xc2\x92ll see you then! (Listens) Okay! '
